page.title: 17WORK IN OVERY
page.content: One of the team working on the defences against the sea describes some of his work. Cockle Path - a short cut to the sea - was in a poor condition. We built up 140 yards of the path by humping mud. We re-planted vegetation for 400 yards by digging up marshes and carting the vegetation by raft to its new home. We placed plastic net wire on top of this to give it a base to cling to. Nearer the sea we bulldozed a pathway through the hills and made a wooden walkway. Still using the bulldozer we strengthened nearby dunes before transplanting marram grass. This has taken hold well and loose sand blown off the beach has gathered on the dunes to provide more resistance. Back on the Staithe we put down rubble and fabric to form a hard area for cars and trailers and launching boats.
